item.title: Offically awarded my PhD degree.
item.description: I was offically awarded my PhD degree. My PhD thesis is titled as “Process-aware Pattern Recognition and Deviation Detection Under Uncertainty”. My PhD research focuses on leveraging domain-specific knowledge (processes) to enhance the performance and interpretability of machine learning models and handling uncertain and probabilistic data.

item.title: Joined DigitLab as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow.
item.description: I joined DigitLab as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow.

item.title: Successfully defend my PhD thesis with no correction.
item.description: Successfully defend my PhD thesis with no correction. My PhD thesis is titled as “Process-aware Pattern Recognition and Deviation Detection Under Uncertainty”. My PhD research focuses on leveraging domain-specific knowledge (processes) to enhance the performance and interpretability of machine learning models and handling uncertain and probabilistic data.

item.title: Present the work of Process-aware Human Activity Recognition at Multimodal AI workshop.
item.description: I presented the work of “Process-aware Human Activity Recognition” at Multimodal AI workshop.

item.title: Present our work of probabilistic conformance checking at HICSS conference in Honolulu, Hawaii.
item.description: Present our work of probabilistic conformance checking at HICSS conference in Honolulu, Hawaii.

item.title: Awarded SCISA research funding.
item.description: I have been awarded the Scottish Informatics and Computer Science Alliance (SCISA) research funding.

item.title: Awarded AIAI, ACRC and IGS student travel grant.
item.description: I have been awarded student travel funding from Artificial Intelligence and its Applications Institute (AIAI), Advanced Care Research Centre (ACRC), and Informatics Graduate School (IGS).

item.title: Our paper “Alignment-based conformance checking over probabilistic events” is accepted by Hawaii International Conference on System Science (HICSS, ranked A).
item.description: Our paper “Alignment-based conformance checking over probabilistic events” is accepted by Hawaii International Conference on System Science (HICSS, ranked A).

item.title: Give a talk on ''Digital Twin for Assisted Living'' at Xidian University.
item.description: I gave a talk on ‘Digital Twin for Assisted Living’ at Xidian University.

item.title: Give a talk on ''Activities of Daily Living of Older Adults'' at Advanced Care Research Centre.
item.description: I gave a talk on ‘‘Activities of Daily Living of Older Adults’’ at Advanced Care Research Centre, Usher Institute.

item.title: Present the work of ''Predictive Behavioural Monitoring in Activities of Daily Livings of Older Adults'' at the International Conference on Health Informatics (HealthINF).
item.description: I presented the paper titled ‘‘Predictive Behavioural Monitoring and Deviation Detection in Activities of Daily Livings of Older Adults’’ at the International Conference on Health Informatics (HealthINF).

item.title: Talk in DigiFest2021: Proactive health monitoring based on Activities of Daily Living
item.description: This talk focused on an onging project. This is aimed at exploiting sensor data on Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) to detect deviations and deterioration from a healthy routine. We also use our models to investigate the realtionship between sleep duration and other activities.
